title: Even newer version : Editor v0.99beta!

There is no separate download for the exe as it wouldn't be enough in itself now.
[url=http://hely.fw.hu/editor/knedit099.zip]hely.fw.hu/editor/knedit099.zip[/url]

As usual, report bugs here. This version may have newer bugs as I haven't tested it with keen maps but hopefully there is none.

Note: you'll need to export the map you're currently working on with v0.5, and import it again with the new one because I've changed the file format![hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Re: Sooooooooooooooooooon!
content:
There's a little help you could do to make editing Keen maps easier for everyone! My game uses 3 separate layers plus a block layer and a sprite layer, so there is that extra layer and the block layer still unused when editing Keen maps. If anyone would help me to identify those blocks that are used for secret passages, I could automatically put them to that extra layer.

Tomorrow I'm gonna write the opposite of the level extractor, and create a test map to see if it's that easy. There's still lot of work on the editor before it gets easy to use, but it's already easier than Ted for many of us, I guess. Not to mention that it runs on XP too [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

What about editing tile images and the tile information itself? Is there a way? Because I can't extract the tile images, I simply read in the already extracted ones as tiles. I want to include them in my editor if it's legal, but I don't know if it is. Anyone can extract their own tileset easily though, with modkeen and a simple image editing program. I will tell you how if you need it.

*EDIT* I forgot to say that I already read all layers and display them in my editor![hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Re: hum
content:
Awesome. Awesome. Awesome!!!!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
Beside working perfectly it also looks pretty good and is a stable level editor.. This is really cool. I can't believe this is really happening! So many have been waiting for this to happen. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Couple of suggestions:
1. Make something values to the bottom bar telling the tile number of the current tile the pointer is hovering above. And the info plane value too.
2. Make the file open dialog have different texts for creating and exporting Keen files. When you go to exporting Keen files and have previously created Keen files, the program still tells the user to select KeenX executable instead of GAMEMAPS. It's a small bug that can easily confuse.

Great work.

Oh, and how do I select a bunch of tiles from the right tile window? Also, it's great that the tile windows' width is adjustable.

Hmmm, zooming to 200% caused the program to crash and to go to something endless loop of showing error message.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: hum
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Oh, and how do I select a bunch of tiles from the right tile window?[hr][/quote]Select the top left tile and shift+click on the bottom right. This creates a brush from the tiles in between which you can use for drawing.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Hmmm, zooming to 200% caused the program to crash and to go to something endless loop of showing error message.[hr][/quote]It does this when I zoom out to 50% percent. Was it what you meant? At the moment the only solution for that is not to zoom out. I don't know why but drawing too many tiles makes openGL crash. It's not an error in it though, as it was never meant to be used like this. Maybe I'll disable that 50% view for Keen. It works well for 32 pixel wide tiles that my game uses.

1. I wanted to do this but I wanted to upload as soon as I can, but the next version will include it.
2. This too will be in the next version! I had some problems with this, but I'm gonna solve it.[hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Huzzah! *tests*
content:
I haven't done much with it so far, but two things I can suggest already:

- The tile plane should adjust itself to the width of the tileset automatically so everything lines up as it's meant to. At the moment it gets set to like five or so tiles wide every time a level is loaded.

- It would be much easier if when a brush is created (click, Shift-click) that brush would be selected automatically, since most of the time the intention is to use that selection of tiles straight away.

Very comfortable so far, though the process of setting everything up could do with some streamlining. Considering the editor wasn't designed specifically for the original Keen games though, it's doing a good job of supporting them. This is an excellent contribution to the Keendom. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Huzzah! *tests*
content:
I've looked up this message on the internet and the information wasn't quiet useful... It can mean many things. The most likely I can think of at the moment is that you video card cannot handle openGL well so openGL doesn't work and my program crashes while using it. I had such exception with openGL before when I tried to draw too much, but this doesn't mean you have the same problem. What are the specs of your video card?

*EDIT* SupFanat (and anyone else with error with opening maps), please [url=http://z-one.uw.hu/files/kndebug.ZIP]download[/url] this debug version. The zip file only contains the exe, replace the previous one with it. Try opening a map with this and tell me the last message you see before the error! It shows numbers from 1 to 20 during opening a map. I've changed the opening sequence a little and it may help but I don't believe it, so I need your help.[hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Re: Huzzah! *tests*
content:
My videocard is Intel740 Win9x PV 4.0. I don't know, does it support OpenGL. Maybe turning off of harware acclesation will help? It will force CPU to do graphics calculations, which videocard can't.
Also good idea for your editor. After changing of left or top edges all adresses for switches, gemholders and etc... must be changed. Could you make it automatic. I.e if you add 10 new tiles in the left, the adress 68;50 (X;Y, numbers are decimal) must be changed to 78;50. Or if you add 10 new tiles in the top, the address 68;50 should be corrected to 68;60. It could be done so:

After changing of these two edges, the info layer is rewiewed.
All values which are more than the number of last icon (~12[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] are changed:

If you add (or remove) x tiles in the left, they must be increased (or decreased) to x, because the horizontal coordinate is stored in a second byte of info value.
If you add (or remove) x tiles in the top, they must be increased (or decreased) to x*256, because the vertical coordinate is stored in a first byte of info value.

I hope, you can undestand, what i mean.[img]http://classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/images/enemyk4-wormouth.gif[/img]

title: Re: Huzzah! *tests*
content:
Well, I dont know, if I'm helpfull (I dont think so *g*), but the KD-leveldata isnt compressed with the carmacize algorithmen (at least afaik), but it is compressed with RLE and huffman (with the node-table somewhere stored in the exe-file). I would be glad if I could post you the offset, however I dont know it, but someone at K:M should know it... Ask MultiMania as he should now it a little bit better

MfG

title: new version
content: Read first post![hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Subliminal messages in Post Titles
content:
I haven't tested these, as I just worked them out then but...

Keen Dreams Shareware v1.31:

Maphead: 0x1FA50 in exe image.
Mapdict: No clue. The huffman dicts are at...

EgaDict: 0x29846
???Dict: 0x29c46
???Dict: 0x2a046

One of these will work and one won't.

For those who care, the maps are stored in KDREAMS.MAP and are in a modified TED5 map format.

There is no !ID! header in the chinks, and possibly other changes. I haven't attempted a detailed examination yet. It is possible that the whole file (with the exception of the TED5v1.0 header is huffman compressed.
